text: Adobo is a Spanish way of preparing food. It involves soaking meat in a marinade made out of vinegar and spices. The name "adobo" is also used for different ways of preparing food in other countries. In the Caribbean, adobo is a dry seasoning instead of a marinade. In the Philippines, adobo is a stew made out of marinated meat. ==History== Adobo is named after the Spanish word "", which means marinade. ==References== Category:Cooking methods Category:Spanish food Category:Filipino food
title: Adobo
